Data: Toss: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has won the toss and India will bowl first. Not very surprising, given the damp conditions. Dhoni said he wanted his bowlers to make best use of the moisture on the surface.
Khan to Gilchrist, no run Zaheer begins with a loosener on the pads, Gilchrist pushes it uppishly to square leg
Khan to Gilchrist, no run good length on off stump, Gilchrist opens the face of the bat and glides it to point
Khan to Gilchrist, no run drifts outside the off stump, left alone, close to being a wide
Khan to Gilchrist, 2 wide big inswing, a little too much as it drifts down the leg side, Dhoni dives to his right but the ball clips his glove
Khan to Hayden, 1 run full and outside off, Hayden gets an outside edge off the toe of the bat and the ball rolls to third man
Khan to Gilchrist, no run good length, thudded in on off stump at a good pace, defended to the on side

Khan to Gilchrist, OUT well that extra delivery has worked! short of a length outside off, shapes away just a touch, Gilchrist gets ready to drive on the up but the ball gets the edge and flies to Tendulkar at first slip
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run inswing for Sreesanth, drifts on the pads, Hayden watches the swing and turns it to the on side
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run swinging in again, on the pads, Hayden pushes to square leg
Sreesanth to Hayden, 1 run Sreesanth (copies Aqib Javed's action..almost), pitches on middle and off, turned to midwicket
Sreesanth to Hodge, no run full in length, not much pace, Hodge has all the time in the world to get forward and defend
Sreesanth to Hodge, no run much fuller, almost a yorker length, defended on the front foot
Sreesanth to Hodge, 1 run just a little wide outside off, Hodge cuts to third man, a bit of an outside edge on that one
Khan to Hodge, no run good length on leg stump, Hodge was just a little late on it, turned to the on side
Khan to Hodge, no run good length outside off, goes on the backfoot and punches to cover
Khan to Hodge, 2 runs drifting down the leg side, Hodge works it with ease off the pads past square leg
Khan to Hodge, no run good length, on the stumps, Hodge gets a good stride forward and defends

Khan to Hodge, no run appeal! good length on middle and leg, moves away a little after pitching, Hodge shuffles and the ball strikes him in line with leg stump, Zaheer appeals but umpire Shastri isnt interested, replays show a big inside edge
Khan to Hodge, 1 leg bye on the pads and worked to fine leg

Sreesanth to Hodge, OUT superb stuff from Sreesanth, pitched up outside off, the late away swing induces Hodge to go for the front-foot drive, the ball gets the outside edge and Dhoni takes it low to his right
Sreesanth to Clarke, no run same delivery, same length, Clarke moves his feet well and defends with the full face of the bat
Sreesanth to Clarke, 2 runs low full toss on middle, Clarke tries to work it to the on side but ends up hitting it back to Sreesanth on the first bounce, Sreesanth misfields
Sreesanth to Clarke, 1 run turned to the on side
Sreesanth to Hayden, 1 run
Sreesanth to Clarke, FOUR runs full and in the slot to drive outside off, Clarke gets a big stride forward and drives between mid-off and cover
Khan to Hayden, no run appeal! good length on off stump, cuts in a little, catches Hayden high on the pad, zaheer appeals, perhaps it was too high
Khan to Hayden, FOUR runs full and asking to be driven, Hayden, almost in his sleep, gets forward and drives past Zaheer's left, no chance of anyone chasing that
Khan to Hayden, 1 run pushed to the left of mid-on for a single
Khan to Clarke, no run
Khan to Clarke, no run good length on off and middle, Clarke goes back and defends to Zaheer
Khan to Clarke, no run

Sreesanth to Hayden, FOUR runs Sreesanth errs by giving him too much width outside off, Hayden gets forward and pusnishes that one past cover, mid-off chases it but to no avail, the ball just sped away
Sreesanth to Hayden, 2 runs attempted yorker, turns into a low full toss, swings in a little, the ball gets an inside edge and rolls past square leg, fine leg picks it up
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run that was quite wide outside off, lucky not to be called, left alone

Sreesanth to Hayden, FOUR runs switches to round the wicket, too full outside off, Hayden gets forward and digs it out with force, the ball beats Yuvraj at point, this outfield is fast, despite the rain
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run holds the length back a little, Hayden lets it go outside off
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run good length on off stump, Hayden gets forward and pushes to mid-off
Khan to Clarke, 1 run good length outside off, Clarke goes back and drives it square on the off side to third man
Khan to Hayden, no run pitched up, good length by Zaheer as he induces Hayden into the drive, he safely pushes that to cover
Khan to Hayden, no run keeps it on a full length outside off, drives to mid-off
Khan to Hayden, no run fullish outside off again, keeps the cover fielder Uthappa busy again
Khan to Hayden, 1 run drifts on the pads, allows hayden to shuffle and work it to the on side for a single
Khan to Clarke, no run good length on off and middle, Clarke shuffles and works it to the on side
Sreesanth to Hayden, 1 run full and outside off, hayden gets a big stride forward, waits on it and square-drives to third man
Sreesanth to Clarke, 1 wide drifts down the leg side, lot of inswing too on that one
Sreesanth to Clarke, no run good length on off stump, good comeback as well, Clarke gets forward and defends
Sreesanth to Clarke, no run fullish, on off stump, worked to the on side
Sreesanth to Clarke, 1 run slower ball, legcutter off the back of the hand, Clarke gets forward and pushes it on the walk to mid-on, sets off quickly for the single
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run round the wicket to Hayden again, good length on middle, Hayden repsects the bowler on that occasion and defends on the front foot with the full face of the bat
Sreesanth to Hayden, no run fullish, on off and middle, gets forward and defends to cover
Khan to Clarke, 1 run good length outside off, not much pace, gets forward and pushes it with soft hands to mid-off who's a little deep
Khan to Hayden, FOUR runs Hayden walks down the track to distract Zaheer, dispatches a short of a length delivery with ease past midwicket, that was an effortless pull
Khan to Hayden, no run
Khan to Hayden, no run fired in outside off stump, left alone
Khan to Hayden, no run pushed with soft hands to short cover
Khan to Hayden, no run fired in short of a good length outside off, lot of pace on that, left alone
Pathan to Clarke, 1 run not much pace, 124 kph, full on off stump, Clarke goes forward and drives to mid-on
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run short of a length, just a bit of width outside off, the lack of pace enables Hayden to go back and cut square, third man picks it up
Pathan to Clarke, no run pushed to short midwicket

Pathan to Clarke, 1 run run-out chance! full on off stump, Clarke gets forward and pushes it to mid-off on the walk with soft hands, sets off fast, Sreesanth picks it up and aims for the non strikers end, misses the stumps
Pathan to Hayden, no run left alone outside the off stump
Pathan to Hayden, no run short and wide, hardly any pace on that, hayden cuts hard to Yuvraj at point
Khan to Clarke, no run good length on middle and leg, works up good pace, Clarke turns it to midwicket
Khan to Clarke, no run good length outside off, pushed to cover
Khan to Clarke, no run fired on off stump, 133 kph, Clarke gets a good stride forward and defends to mid-off
Khan to Clarke, no run ball clips the pad and rolls back to the keeper

Khan to Clarke, no run wowee! how did that miss? in the corridor of uncertainty outside off, the ball kicks off a good length, Clarke tries to drive but the ball somehow beats the outside edge, best ball of the morning so far
Khan to Clarke, no run pushed back to the bowler
Pathan to Hayden, no run Hayden takes a couple of paces down the track to distract Pathan, the ball pitches on a good length, attempted pull, the ball rolls to the on side
Pathan to Hayden, no run Dhoni stands close to the stumps after watching Hayden, Hayden tries to cut square on the off side and misses
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run full on middle and leg, Hayden pushes it to the right of mid-on
Pathan to Clarke, no run outside off stump, Clarke tries to cut square , misses
Pathan to Clarke, no run
Pathan to Clarke, 1 run good length on middle and leg, turned off the hips to the on side
Sreesanth to Clarke, FOUR runs .... and is welcomed by a lofted stroke over mid-off, Clarke takes a few paces forward, meets the pitch of the ball and lofts
Sreesanth to Clarke, no run good length on middle and leg, turned to the on side
Sreesanth to Clarke, no run full in length, outside off, Clarke square drives to Yuvraj at point, the crowd gets excited thinking its a catch, goes on the bounce
Sreesanth to Clarke, FOUR runs full, on off and middle, had 'hit me' written all over it, Clarke obliges by lofting it straight over the bowler's head, oen bouce and four
Sreesanth to Clarke, 1 run slower ball. legcutter off the back of the hand, driven past the bowler
Sreesanth to Hayden, 1 run full in length on middle and leg, turned to square leg
Pathan to Hayden, 2 runs full and pushed past mid-on
Pathan to Hayden, no run good length outside off, punched towards point
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run pushed with soft hands to mid-off, hayden sets off in a flash, the fielder picks it up and aims at the non strikers stumps, he hits but Hayden made his ground
Pathan to Clarke, no run pushed to the off side
Pathan to Clarke, 1 run pushed to the off side for a single
Pathan to Hayden, no run pushed back to the bowler
Harbhajan to Clarke, no run tossed on middle and off, turned to the region of forward short leg
Harbhajan to Clarke, no run pushed in flatter, turned to midwicket
Harbhajan to Clarke, no run Clarke takes a couple of paces forward, decides to defend
Harbhajan to Clarke, 1 run fired in on middle and leg, turned past midwicket
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run good turn, spins from leg to off, Hayden gets beaten
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run pushed back to the bowler
Pathan to Clarke, no run Outside off and driven away to the off side. Straight to the fielder, though

Pathan to Clarke, 3 runs outside off again, almost cannon fodder for Clarke who slaps it over the off side. Not that well timed and the ball is stopped before it reaches the boundary. They hurry through for three
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run quick single from Hayden this time, direct hit would have been close but Karthik misses

Pathan to Clarke, 1 wide, OUT got 'em! Great work by Dhoni behind the stumps. That was a poor ball down leg side but Clarke can't get hold of the flick and over-balances after the stroke. Dhoni, standing up to the stumps, collects it nearly and flicks off the bails in a flash. Easy decision for the umpire that
Pathan to Symonds, no run Beaten first up. 131kph from Irfan and Symonds tries to angle his bat cutely. Can't read the seam movement and the ball goes through to Dhoni.
Pathan to Symonds, no run Dhoni comes up again. Straight ball that time and Symonds plays it cautiously down the ground
Pathan to Symonds, no run straight and good length again, 131kph and no room to free the arms. That's what he did so well in the World Twenty20 and he's continuing the same here.
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run slightly short and cut away fiercely but it's straight to the cover fielder. Hayden practises the shot. Slip in place by the way
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run quicker one from Harbhajan. A bit of extra zip off that one. Hayden waits for it but is beaten by the pace.
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run another quicker one, left alone by Hayden. Good pace variation by Harbhajan
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run offspinner again, slightly quick, left alone again.
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run Out comes the sweep, full ball on the pads and Hayden spanks it to fine leg for a single

Harbhajan to Symonds, no run Slightly slower one from Harbhajan, 60mph on that occassion. Draws Symonds forward and has him poking at it. Bobs up on the leg side but short of the fielder. No run that time
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run Pathan continues with his straight ones. Good control there. Patted away to the off side tamely
Pathan to Symonds, no run defended to the off side. straight one again
Pathan to Symonds, no run full and on the off stump, driven confidently to cover but straight to the fielder
Pathan to Symonds, 1 run short and wide but Symonds doesn't cash in as he should. Slapped away but straight to third man for a single. Pathan might be better off keeping it straight and simple.
Pathan to Hayden, no run that's the one, good length ball on and around off. Hayden pats it to cover and goes about practising the stroke again.
Pathan to Hayden, no run just outside off and left alone. Pathan is garnering Hayden's respect. Arms shouldered
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run lobbed up on off, not much turn but Symonds decides to push it back down the ground to the bowler
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run Bit more intent from Symonds. That was slightly tossed up again and he charges down and pushes it to long-on. Australia need a move along.
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run more shouldering of arms. Hayden playing it safe here. Biding his time for the assault. At the moment, though, it appears to be some deoderant advert.
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run

Harbhajan to Symonds, 2 runs Symonds charges down the ground again and lofts over extra cover. Doesn't get the timing right and they manage a couple. These two are so powerful that under-edges usually go for six but they're yet to get into full flow.
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run drifting down leg, Symonds misses
Pathan to Hayden, no run
Pathan to Hayden, 1 run

Pathan to Symonds, FOUR runs short of a length and outside off, Symonds gets a thickish edge that races away to third man for four. Not in control but runs are runs. Pathan smiles that cherubic smile.
Pathan to Symonds, no run good retort from the bowler. Good length ball on off and moving in a shade. Symonds in a quandary whether to hit or defend. Ends up in knots.

Pathan to Symonds, FOUR runs This one is deliberate. On middle and off and Symonds opens the face of the bat and glides it to third man for another four. Words exchanged but that was really well played. A big man luke Symonds can do cute bits too

Pathan to Symonds, FOUR runs And that's brutal. Two cute glides followed by a rapacious slap. Too short, too wide and Symonds isn't going to miss out on that one. Creams it past cover for four. Pathan finally stops smiling. It's been that kind of over
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run Hayden tries to open up his shoulders now. These two complement each other well. Uppish cut but it's short of the fielder at point. They scramble a single

Harbhajan to Symonds, SIX runs Crack! Down the pitch he comes and pulps that over deep long-on for a big one. Symonds not looking back anymore. These are meaty blows. Bring on the wild pigs, he seems to be saying
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run full and straight. A dart almost. Pushed back to the bowler
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run flatter and quicker on the pads, dribbled away to the leg side
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 wide sharp offbreak, turning from middle to leg and wide is called
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run quicker one and straight, tapped away to the leg side
Powar to Hayden, no run slow start as expected, Padded away by Hayden. Exaggerated stride forward and a gentle kick.
Powar to Hayden, 2 runs sweep this time, well struck and picks up two to fine leg
Powar to Hayden, no run slow one on middle and spinning away to off, left alone
Powar to Hayden, 1 run 86.7kph that time and tapped away to the off side for a single
Powar to Symonds, no run Change of pace. In the late 70s this time. Symonds has no pace to work on and pushes it to the off side

Powar to Symonds, SIX runs Bang! Another slower one but this time Symonds decides enough is enough. Down the ground and scooped way over midwicket for a big one. He's launching the assault now. And it's just the 22nd over.

Harbhajan to Hayden, no run Hayden edges to the off side but doesn't want the single. Symonds is halfway down the pitch and slips slightly too but Uthappa juggles and doesn't get the throw in time. Opportunity squandered for India
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run pushed down the ground for a single
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run firm drive to long-on
Harbhajan to Hayden, no run bit of extra bounce for Harbhajan, defended cautiously down the ground. It's obvious that Hayden is biding his time and Symonds is going for it
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run Nudged away to the leg side for a quick one

Harbhajan to Symonds, 2 runs Sensible paddle on the leg side for an easy two. Symonds is mixing gentle touches with brute force effectively. It's difficult to bowl to batsmen when they know when to slap and when to caress.
Powar to Hayden, 1 run Confident push down the ground. Hayden working this to a plan
Powar to Symonds, 1 run too easy this, driven to long-on for another single
Powar to Hayden, no run slower through the air, Hayden on the back foot and slightly poking towards the off side
Powar to Hayden, FOUR runs tossed up on legstump and Hayden smacks his lips, gets on his haunches and sweeps savagely to fine leg for a four. Suddenly batting looks much easier than earlier

Powar to Hayden, no run big appeal but that was likely to miss the off stump. Powar is bowling over the wicket but that pitched on line. Problem was it was turning away and would have missed off. Hayden can't make contact while sweeping but he was safe that time
Powar to Hayden, 1 run

Harbhajan to Hayden, SIX runs That's a screamer. Hayden simply gets down on his haunches and whistles that over midwicket for a big six. Harbhajan isn't saying much now. Hayden in such form is best left alone. And by the way he's brought up his fifty. Raises the bat as if to say, 'Now that's just the first cou
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run Tapped away for a single. It's amazing how often the Aussies take a single after they've managed a boundary
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run flatter on off and Symonds pushes behind square for a quick single
Harbhajan to Hayden, 1 run Hayden takes a big stride back and pushes to the on side
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run fired in, pushed to mid-on
Powar to Hayden, no run short and slow, cut away to the off side but straight to the fielder
Powar to Hayden, no run
Powar to Hayden, 1 run swept away past short fine leg for a single. Powar drifting too much down leg in this spell. Those red goggles are not working today, it seems
Powar to Symonds, no run slow and teasing, that's what he's good at, tapped away to the off side
Powar to Symonds, 1 run better line it seems, Symonds down the track but can only manage a single.

Powar to Hayden, no run that's really well bowled. Sees Hayden showing signs of coming down the track and pushes it through faster. Hayden changes his mind and tries to glide it to third man but is beaten.
Tendulkar to Symonds, FOUR runs and he's been carted to midwicket first up. A long-hop to start with and Symonds pulls violently to midwicket for four. Well begun is ...
Tendulkar to Symonds, 1 run short again, outside off and Symonds goes for the savage cut. Straight to the point fielder though and a misfield allows them to take a quick single
Tendulkar to Hayden, 1 run wide of the stumps and cut away to deep point for a single

Tendulkar to Symonds, 1 run another wide one and Symonds goes for the cut again but can't get the placement. Manages a single. Karthik diving around quite needlessly. Wonder who's paying the laundry bills
Tendulkar to Hayden, no run pushed down the ground
Tendulkar to Hayden, no run cut to backward point. Good end to the over, he seemed to be finding some rhythm there.
Powar to Symonds, no run drifting down leg, patted away to the on side
Powar to Symonds, no run 83.6kph, Symonds down the ground and back to the bowler. Powar varying his pace is quite a handful to play.
Powar to Symonds, 1 run
Powar to Hayden, 1 run
Powar to Symonds, no run
Powar to Symonds, 1 run driven to wide long-off for a single

Tendulkar to Symonds, FOUR runs quicker one, bowled from a medium-pacer's action almost and Symonds cutely paddles it to fine leg for a four. Deliberately played and the ball beats the slow outfield to race away.
Tendulkar to Symonds, 1 run short and slightly wide, cut away effortlessly past point for a single
Tendulkar to Hayden, 1 run full and quicker, Hayden ready to launch it to Trivandrum but manages to only cudgel it to long-on for a single
Tendulkar to Symonds, no run on the short side again, Symonds gets a thick edge that goes towards point
Tendulkar to Symonds, no run
Tendulkar to Symonds, no run can't free his arms with that one, shovelled to mid-off
Powar to Hayden, SIX runs Thwack! Down the ground and pumelled away way over midwicket for a big six. Powar tossed that up and Hayden, as if swallowing a lollypop, smoted that
Powar to Hayden, no run
Powar to Hayden, no run worked away off the pad
Powar to Hayden, 1 run moves away and axed down the ground for a single
Powar to Symonds, 1 run quicker one, on middle and leg, tapped away to the leg side for a single
Powar to Hayden, 1 run on the pads and turned away for a single. Easy like Andy. Six and a few singles. Thanks very much. Okeydokey.
Tendulkar to Hayden, 1 run fired inm outside off, Hayden gives it his all and cuts fiercely
Tendulkar to Symonds, 1 run legcutter on off stump, pushed down to long-off
Tendulkar to Hayden, no run fired in at medium pace, Hayden gets forward and drives to short cover
Tendulkar to Hayden, SIX runs tossed up and hayden steps down and lofts that straight, no effort in that stroke
Tendulkar to Hayden, no run
Tendulkar to Hayden, 1 run offcutter on off stump, pushed firmly to the off side

Pathan to Hayden, OUT that was a masterstroke! Pathan fires in a yorker on leg stump, Hayden shuffles and tries to work it to the on side, the ball sneaks under the bat and takes the leg stump. oh and full marks to Dhoni for that bowling change
Pathan to Haddin, no run Pathan, with renewed confidence fires that outside off at a good pace, haddin glides that to the off side
Pathan to Haddin, no run slips in a full length delivery, Haddin digs it out to cover
Pathan to Haddin, no run outside off and punched to the off side
Pathan to Haddin, 1 run offcutter on the pads, turned off the pads to deep square leg
Pathan to Symonds, 2 runs length ball on leg stump, Symonds goes back and across and turns it off his pads towards deep square leg
Harbhajan to Haddin, no run flighted on off stump, defended on the frontfoot to the on side
Harbhajan to Haddin, no run turned to Pathan at square leg, the batsmen contemplate a single but decide otherwise
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run tucked away towards square leg
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run flighted on off, pushed back to Harbhajan
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run tossed on middle and leg, turned to mid-on
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run good ball, fired that in short of a good length, Symonds goes forward and the ball just kicks on him and hits him high on the thigh pad
Pathan to Haddin, no run skiddy delivery outside off, Haddin defends to the off side
Pathan to Haddin, 1 run just short of a good length on middle, Haddin tucks it away easily off his pads to square leg
Pathan to Symonds, 1 run drifts outside off and glided to third man with an open face
Pathan to Haddin, no run full toss, outside off, attempted yorker, Haddin cant put that away as he drives to mid-off
Pathan to Haddin, 1 run just drifting on the leg side this time, Haddin works it to the on side
Pathan to Symonds, 1 run fuller in length, on off and middle, driven on the up past the gap between cover and point, the fielder at the deep picks it up
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run tossed on off stump, driven to long-off
Harbhajan to Haddin, SIX runs Haddin decides enough is enough and slog sweeps over deep midwicket, the best part was he stayed rooted to the crease while playing that
Harbhajan to Haddin, 2 runs
Harbhajan to Haddin, no run
Harbhajan to Haddin, 4 byes oho! just how did that miss? flighted on off stump, Haddin goes forward to defend, the ball turns and bounces and misses batsman, stumps and keeper in a glorious sequence
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run
Pathan to Haddin, 1 wide tucked to the on side
Pathan to Haddin, no run good length on off stump, Haddin defends hard and the ball loops up on the bounce to mid-on
Pathan to Haddin, 3 wide sliding down leg, tries to flick it but misses, Dhoni takes it on the thumb and he's in a bit of discomfort..ouch!
Pathan to Haddin, no run full, on middle and leg, restricts Haddin from scoring, played back to Pathan
Pathan to Haddin, no run outside off and pushed to the off side
Pathan to Haddin, no run
Pathan to Haddin, 1 run
Pathan to Symonds, no run
Yuvraj to Haddin, no run
Yuvraj to Haddin, 1 run drifting on the pads and tucked to square leg
Yuvraj to Symonds, no run played back to the bowler
Yuvraj to Symonds, 1 run Symonds takes a few paces forward, changes his mind on lofting it and instead waits on it and dabs to third man
Yuvraj to Haddin, 1 run played to the off side
Yuvraj to Symonds, 1 run
Pathan to Symonds, 1 run
Pathan to Haddin, no run good length outside off, played back on the front foot to the bowler
Pathan to Haddin, no run appeal! slower ball, off cutter hits Haddin on the pads, Bucknor says no.. our guess is that the ball may have pitched outside leg
Pathan to Haddin, FOUR runs outside off and Haddin slashes that past the slip region, the ball gets the top half of the bat and races away
Pathan to Haddin, no run
Pathan to Haddin, 1 run on the pads and turned away to the leg side
Yuvraj to Haddin, 1 run pushed gently to short third-man, Tendulkar picks up the ball and fires that to Dhoni, the batsmen were a little too quick for him
Yuvraj to Symonds, FOUR runs short and pulled away to deep midwicket
Yuvraj to Symonds, FOUR runs outside off anf glided past third man, good placement
Yuvraj to Symonds, no run
Yuvraj to Symonds, no run
Yuvraj to Symonds, no run just short of a length outside off, the batsman goes back and slams that past the infield
Harbhajan to Haddin, SIX runs flighted on off and Haddin gives it the royal whack, gets down on his knee and slog sweeps over deep midwicket
Harbhajan to Haddin, no run played back to the bowler
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run
Harbhajan to Symonds, no run tossed on middle and leg, turned to the on side
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run pushed in flatter, on leg, pushed to the on side
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run outside off and glided towards third man
Khan to Haddin, 1 run Full and outside off and Haddin bunts it away to the off side for a single

Khan to Symonds, no run short of a length and outside off, ball stopping on Symonds and he tries to cut it away but can't get the timing right. Inside edge could have gone on to the stumps but goes to Dhoni
Khan to Symonds, 2 runs clattered away with a horizontal bat down the ground, racing away four four but stopped well for Gambhir at long-on
Khan to Symonds, 1 run glided away to third man for a single
Khan to Haddin, 1 run outside off and angled away to third man, there's a fielder inside the circle but it beats him. Simple single there

Khan to Symonds, no run holds it back a bit and short of a length. Ball stopping on the batsmen a bit now. Symonds tries to cut but can't make contact. Sign of a two-paced pitch for the second innings?
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run Worked away for an easy single to the leg side
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run low full toss, bunted away wide of long-off for a single
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run another low full toss from Harbhajan, gently tapped away to midwicket by Haddin
Harbhajan to Symonds, 1 run fired in on the pads but Symonds is up to the task, whips it away behind square for a single

Harbhajan to Haddin, FOUR runs attempted leg-stump yorker but Haddin is quick to pounce on it, glancing it fine, past Dhoni and past short fine leg for four. It was a really quick one and ran away to the fence
Harbhajan to Haddin, 1 run another fired in delivery, low full toss for a single down the ground
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run Full and straight, on off, driven to the off side for a single
Sreesanth to Symonds, 1 run short of a length, outside off, Symonds backs away and thinks of swatting it away but can't get the timing on it
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run slightly slower one, Haddin cautiously pats it to the off side for a single
Sreesanth to Symonds, no run slower one that time, 100kph, Symonds has to wait for an age for that and cuts it straight to point. Sreesanth doing a good job now
Sreesanth to Symonds, 1 run another slower one, legcutter again, pushed away to the leg side. Sreesanth has a word with Symonds. It turns into several words. Symonds reponds. A smile is exchanged.
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run pushed to long-off efficiently
Khan to Haddin, 1 run yorker from Zaheer, Hadden is forced to dig it out towards the off side, that's the length India need at the moment.
Khan to Symonds, 1 run Symonds backs away and charges too, blasted away to long-off but straight to the fielder. Australia will look to launch towards 300 now.
Khan to Haddin, 1 run Good ball again, over the wicket and yorker length again. Haddin seems comfortable taking the single and handing over strike to Symonds.
Khan to Symonds, FOUR runs Full pitched ball outside off, sliced away by Symonds, past point and wide of third man for a four. This man is dangerous in these phases. Pumping iron almost

Khan to Symonds, FOUR runs full length ball but that was creamed away with immense power, down the ground past the bowler for another four. He didn't middle it really but when has that ever been the criterion in the modern age? Bring on those heavy bats
Khan to Symonds, 1 run Down the ground again but settles for the single. Keeps the strike.
Sreesanth to Symonds, 1 run full one from Sreesanth, driven powerfully by Symonds, through extra cover for a single. They look for two but the fielder is alert enough to get the throw back in fast

Sreesanth to Haddin, FOUR runs Too easy, full and straight and Haddin goes straight, on the back foot and thumping down the ground for a superb four. He's negating all the swing by standing outside the crease. Actually the only swing present there concerns the bat.

Sreesanth to Haddin, no run Slower ball that Haddin tries to pull, misses completely and Sreesanth runs up to field the ball. A few words exchanged and there's more drama here. Sreesanth appeals to the umpire (one thinks for running out Symonds at the non-striker's end) and there are a few words exchanged with
Sreesanth to Haddin, 2 runs
Sreesanth to Haddin, FOUR runs creamed through extra cover for four, that's a full-blooded drive. So many words being exchanged, yet Haddin has played a super shot here
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 leg bye worked away for an extra
Khan to Haddin, 1 run pulled away to midwicket, they go for a quick single and Harbhajan goes for the direct hit. One stump to aim at and he misses. Had he hit, Haddin was gone
Khan to Symonds, 1 run round the wicket this time, short and directed at the ribs, Symonds pulls but can only get a single to deep square leg
Khan to Haddin, no run yorker length ball again, good stuff from Zaheer, Haddin tries to go straight but can only dribble it back to the bowler
Khan to Haddin, 1 run full and straight again, drilled to long-off for a single. Pathan is quick, keeps them down to one
Khan to Symonds, no run slower one this time, 105kph and Symonds can't adjust his shot in the last moment, tries to cut but he's too early
Khan to Symonds, 1 run full and straight on the pads, dug out to long-on for a single. Fine over from Zaheer, mixing up his pace and length intelligently. India need more of the same.
Sreesanth to Symonds, 1 run full and outside off, Symonds tries to make room but can't get the elevation, tapped to the off side and they complete a quick single
Sreesanth to Haddin, no run Another slower ball, Sreesanth doing this well, Haddin lines up for a mighty heave-ho over midwicket but is too early on the shot, that nearly went onto the stumps
Sreesanth to Haddin, FOUR runs too predictable this time. A slower one again, ends up as a low full toss and Haddin swishes it over midwicket for four.
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run Full toss this time and that too on the pads but Haddin doesn't get hold of it, straight to the fielder

Sreesanth to Symonds, OUT another slower one and this time he strikes. It's full on leg stump and Symonds tries to smack it over midwicket, only manages to get a leading edge that balloons up high in the air. Sreesanth gets himself under it and completes a smart catch. Sreesanth celebrates with a leer, Symonds
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run Keeps the strike with a push to cover
Yuvraj to Haddin, 1 run Tapped away to the off side for a single
Yuvraj to Hopes, 1 run turned away to the on side
Yuvraj to Haddin, no run
Yuvraj to Haddin, FOUR runs some turn for Yuvraj there, Haddin gets a thick edge past the keeper for four, Yuvraj beat him with spin there but you expect this in the final stages of a one-dayer
Yuvraj to Haddin, 2 runs slower this time and Haddin tries to pull, under-edge this time and past the keeper for two. Outside edge done, inside edge done, what ya got left?
Yuvraj to Haddin, 1 run Reverse-sweep comes out. He can't get the placement, though, and smacks it straight to short third man (or short fine leg if you prefer)
Khan to Haddin, 1 run slow ball for Zaheer, cut away to point for a single. He's done a fine job towards the end here
Khan to Hopes, 1 run backs away and tries to slog it but can't get hold of a low full toss, skied to long-off and it drops short of the fielder
Khan to Haddin, FOUR runs full toss this time and Haddin smacks it down the ground for a four. Two fielders converge, one dives but it doesn't matter.

Khan to Haddin, SIX runs Slow ball after slow ball and one's going to go outside the ground. Haddin middles that and deposits it miles over midwicket. It's cleared many stands. Scattered the crowd even.
Khan to Haddin, 1 wide too far outside off and Haddin, trying to swish it to the leg side, can afford to miss it. It's called wide
Khan to Haddin, no run

Khan to Haddin, FOUR runs That's as cute as it gets. Twenty20 stuff from Haddin. Full toss on middle from Zaheer and Haddin moves across and scoops it past fine leg. He gets hold of it and it races away for four. Premidated and efficient. Haddin hurting India here
Sreesanth to Hopes, 2 runs full and on the pads, flicked away to midwicket for a couple

Sreesanth to Hopes, OUT slower ball works this time, outside off and Hopes slashes wildly, straight to Dravid at extra cover. High Hopes crash. Local boy Sreesanth has three wickets now. His aim was to get five. He has four balls left to achieve it.
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run yorker this time and Haddin can't get proper hold of it.
Sreesanth to Lee, 1 run slower ball, crunched to the off side but just a single
Sreesanth to Haddin, 1 run another slower one, full and straight, driven powerfully to long-on but he can't get the elevation and has to settle for one
Sreesanth to Lee, 5 wide fast and furious at 140kph, way down leg side and it races away for four wides. Adam Gilchrist applauds from the dressing-room.
Sreesanth to Lee, 1 run yorker length, dug out for a single.
Join us in a while for the second innings. Kanishkaa will take you through the early overs of India's run-chase

India's bowlers threatened in phases but the Australian batting proved too strong yet again. They were done in by the rain in the first match but will hope to wrap this one up without much fuss. However India have chased 300-plus targets in the past and there is also a small matter of rain hovering around.

So Australia end on an imposing 306 for 6 in their 50 overs. Like in Bangalore they recovered from a shaky start. From 8 for 2, Symonds and Hayden propped them up before Haddin provided the finishing touches with a valuable 87.
We're back. Brett Lee has the new ball. Gambhir will take first strike. Two slips in place
Thanks Sid. India did chase over 300 in this ground, back in 2000 against South Africa, and it was a nail-biter. The pitch did appear a little two-paced so run scoring won't be very easy.
Lee to Gambhir, 1 wide inauspicious start for Australia and Lee, sliding way down leg, early workout for Gilchrist diving to his right
Lee to Gambhir, no run thats much better, good pace and bounce outside off and Gambhir lets it go
Lee to Gambhir, no run 123 kph, good length outside off stump, fended to the off side
Lee to Gambhir, no run good length outside off, Gambhir gets his left foot across the stumps and meets the ball off a full face the bat, plays towards cover
Lee to Gambhir, 1 wide extra effort from Lee but for nothing, thuds it short and the bal climbs over Gambhir and slides down leg as well
Lee to Gambhir, no run appeal! full and swinging in on the pads, gambhir gets caught on the shuffle but the ball was sliding down leg
Lee to Gambhir, no run played down to the on side
Lee to Gambhir, 1 run fuller in length, aimed at the body and Gambhir shuffles and plays off the hips towards square leg
Johnson to Gambhir, no run 87.8 mph, good ball to start with, outside off, moves away just a touch, Gambhir goes back and turns it to the on side
Johnson to Gambhir, no run outside off, no room to cut, Gambhir plays a confident backward defensive stroke
Johnson to Gambhir, no run varies his length with a yorker length aimed outside off, turns into a low full toss, driven to mid-on off the toe edge of the bat
Johnson to Gambhir, 2 runs short and pulled, not quite well timed as the ball lands just past the circle at midwicket, risky stroke
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR runs glorious! there were shades of Sanath Jayasuriya there as Gambhir whips a full length delivery from outside off over midwicket with minimum effort
Johnson to Gambhir, no run gambhir follows up the boundary with a fend to the off side
Lee to Tendulkar, no run banged in outside off, Tendulkar does well to let it go
Lee to Tendulkar, no run Lee spits fire with another short delivery which kicks and moves away alarmingly after pitching, wake-up call for sachin
Lee to Tendulkar, no run banged in outside off again, 89 mph, safely negotiated, left alone
Lee to Tendulkar, no run full in length, straight on off stump, no swing, pushed to mid-off
Lee to Tendulkar, 2 runs lovely stroke, full and in the slot to drive, Tendulakr gets on the front foot and bisects the gap between extra cover and mid-off
Lee to Tendulkar, no run pushed to the off side
Johnson to Uthappa, 4 runs oopsy! bad bounce for Johnson and Gilchrist as the ball beats the batsmen on the low bounce and well, misses everybody
Johnson to Uthappa, FOUR runs drifting on the hips, Uthappa works it fine and the ball races to the fine-leg boundary in a flash
Johnson to Uthappa, 1 wide sliding down leg, Johnson doesnt look too thrilled with the call
Johnson to Uthappa, no run left alone outside the off stump
Johnson to Uthappa, no run
Johnson to Uthappa, no run fired in on a good length on off and middle, Uthappa gets his high backlift down to meet the ball on the sweetspot of the bat, pushed back to the bowler
Lee to Tendulkar, no run oh! full and tempting Tendulkar to drive square outside off, the ball keeps a little low on the way to the keeper
Lee to Tendulkar, 1 run nudged to midwicket, Sachin sets off fast, the fielder (couldnt identify him) runs to pick it up but he sort of over-runs it
Lee to Uthappa, no run played back to the bowler
Lee to Uthappa, no run slower ball and full on off stump ,Uthappa plays at it a little too early and almost chops it to mid-on
Lee to Uthappa, FOUR runs take that! full, outside off, Uthappa gets down on his knee and executes a pleasing square drive past point, uppish but safe

Lee to Uthappa, FOUR runs and another! this time he bisects the gap between point and cover with another square drive, he meets the pitch of the ball with a big stride forward, this was also uppish though safe
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run outside off and left alone to the keeper
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run slower ball outside off, gets forward and pushes it off an open face to point
Johnson to Tendulkar, 1 wide bouncer! too high and more than enough height for the umpire to call a wide
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run played towards gully, Uthappa set off from the other end and on being sent back was just a little too lazy in getting back. The throw just misses the stumps
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run full and drive back firmly, Johnson does well to get a hand to it
Johnson to Tendulkar, 1 run full and driven towards mid-off, not enough power in that to beat the man there, pleasing stroke all the same
Johnson to Uthappa, 1 run outside off and the outside edge goes to third man
Lee to Uthappa, SIX runs Fearlessness of youth! short of a length, Uthappa executes a flat-batted swat over long-on, the ball landed quote a few yards over the rope
Lee to Uthappa, no run full and pushed towards the covers
Lee to Uthappa, 1 run glided down to third man for a single
Lee to Tendulkar, (no ball) SIX runs short and pulled away over deep square leg, sachin got into position really quickly, what's more, its a Free Hit thanks to the front-foot no-ball
Lee to Tendulkar, no run well Tendulkar coudnt do anything with that, yorker outside off, Tendulkar backs away to slice the ball past the infield, misses
Lee to Tendulkar, FOUR runs he's back in business with a glorious flick off the wrists past the diving square leg fielder, Lee errs in length and line and pays for it
Lee to Tendulkar, no run driven on the up towards cover
Johnson to Uthappa, 1 run good length outside off, punched towards point for a single
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run good length outside off and pushed to the off side
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run beaten! squared him up with one that shaped away outside off after pitching, Johnson gets excited with that
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run pushed back to the bowler
Johnson to Tendulkar, no run fuller in length, draws him forward, pushed back to the bowler
Johnson to Tendulkar, 2 runs misfield, Tendulkar pushes it down towards the covers, Haddin is a little too late on the dive and the ball goes past him and stops before the boundary
Clark to Uthappa, FOUR runs full, on off and middle, Uthappa plants his front foot forward and drives it so easily past the bowler, Clark errs by bowling to Uthappa's strengths
Clark to Uthappa, 1 run full and pushed to the off side
Clark to Tendulkar, no run holds the length back, Tendulkar nudges that to the on side
Clark to Tendulkar, no run strange stroke, Tendulkar tries to paddle it from outside off, premeditated but too early on the stroke, the ball hits the back of the bat and rolls to the off side
Clark to Yuvraj, no run pushed back firmly to Clark, he nearly flings the ball back to Yuvraj
Johnson to Uthappa, 1 run slower ball, 63 mph, glided past the diving gully down to third man
Johnson to Yuvraj, 1 run tucked away to square leg
Johnson to Uthappa, 1 wide drifts down the leg side, left alone
Johnson to Uthappa, no run outside off and fended towards point
Johnson to Uthappa, no run good length outside off, glided towards point again

Johnson to Uthappa, SIX runs cracked off the front foot, that was full outside off, Uthappa waits on it, gets on his knee and golf scoops it over the straight boundary, Johnson knew he deserved it, He shut his eyes and walked back
Johnson to Uthappa, no run
Clark to Yuvraj, no run
Clark to Yuvraj, no run pushed to mid-off for a quick single, running wasnt quite up to the mark, Yuvraj scampers to the crease and Lee's throw was just a little too wide
Clark to Yuvraj, 1 run
Clark to Uthappa, 1 run
Clark to Yuvraj, 1 run the ball stops on Yuvraj, it lobs in the air towards mid-on
Clark to Uthappa, no run beaten, outside off, Uthappa tries to glide that to third man, nearly gets the outside edge
Hopes to Yuvraj, (no ball) starts off with a no-ball, pushed to the off side. But.... replays showed that a part of the foot was behind the line
Hopes to Yuvraj, 1 run
Hopes to Uthappa, 1 run
Hopes to Dravid, no run
Hopes to Dravid, no run pushed down to the off side
Clark to Uthappa, no run drifting down leg, Uthappa shapes to glance it fine, the ball clips the thigh pad en route to the keeper
Clark to Uthappa, no run
Clark to Uthappa, no run good length on off stump, defended back to Clark
Clark to Uthappa, 1 run full, drifting on the pads, Uthappa shuffles and whips it in the air over square leg, fine leg runs across and picks it up on the first bounce
Clark to Dravid, no run fullish length on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
Clark to Dravid, no run Clark digs it in short, catches the batsman on the hop, the ball clips the shoulder and rolls away behind the batsman
Hopes to Uthappa, 1 run on off and middle, Dravid goes back and glides it with an open face to cover
Hopes to Dravid, no run full, on middle and leg, Dravid flicks off his wrists to midwicket
Hopes to Dravid, no run slower ball outside off, pushed to cover
Hopes to Dravid, no run
Hopes to Dravid, FOUR runs full and too much width outside off, Dravid leans onto the drive and bisects the gap between cover and mid-off, Gilchrist stands close to the stumps by the way
Hopes to Dravid, 1 run glided down to third man for a single
Clark to Dravid, 1 run glided down to third man with an open face
Clark to Dhoni, no run good length outside off, pushed to cover
Clark to Dhoni, no run maintains the stump to stump line, played back to the bowler
Clark to Dhoni, no run shifts his line to outside the off stump, Dhoni gauges the bounce and lets it go
Clark to Dhoni, no run outside off, Dhoni tries to cut but finds the point fielder
Hopes to Dravid, no run patted away to the off side
Hopes to Dravid, no run straight and stifling, played back to the bowler
Hopes to Dravid, FOUR runs elegant, cheeky and smart. Outside off and Dravid angles his bat calmy to steer the ball for a four. Good thinking.
Hopes to Dravid, no run driven to mid-on. Dravid middling it well here
Hopes to Dravid, no run 132kph, outside off and Dravid tries the cheeky glide again, misses this time and Gilchrist, standing up, collects it well

Hopes to Dravid, no run drifting down leg and it's tucked away to square leg, no run though. Hopes doing a good job. He must be a delight for headline writes across newspapers. High Hopes, Australia pin their Hopes on James etc etc .. Bottom line is he's doing his job.
Clark to Dhoni, no run tapped to the off side, Dhoni biding his time here
Clark to Dhoni, 1 run full on the pads, worked away close to the stumps and scurried through for a single

Clark to Dravid, 1 leg bye Close shave for Dravid there, he pushed it to the leg side and took off for a single but ambled towards the end of it. Gilchrist, in a smart move, fired in a direct hit at the non-striker's end and Dravid just made it there. Another second or so and he was gone.
Clark to Dhoni, 2 runs short and pulled away in a controlled fashion to fine leg, well fielded at the boundary.
Clark to Dhoni, no run full and on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Dhoni getting into his groove here. Not trying anything adventurous
Clark to Dhoni, no run short and slightly wide, cut away but a half-hearted shot that time. Straight to the fielder
Hopes to Dravid, no run on middle, drifting to leg, tries to push straight but thick inside edge goes straight to the fielder behind square
Hopes to Dravid, no run straight and irritatingly good from Hopes. These are the sort of bowlers who succeed through infuriating, defended back to the bowler
Hopes to Dravid, no run straight again, good pace variation too, Dravid has no room to free his arms.
Hopes to Dravid, no run just can't get it away, straight to short midwicket
Hopes to Dravid, 1 run slightly down leg this time and finally a single. Flicked down the fine leg
Hopes to Dhoni, 1 run good finish to the over, straight again and Dhoni can only turn it away for a single to square leg
Clark to Dhoni, no run good length, pushed to cover, good spell fof Australia this
Clark to Dhoni, no run pushed to cover. India need a partnership but the asking rate is also soaring
Clark to Dhoni, 1 run short ball, the length is being varied well, Dhoni gets a measured pull, keeps the ball down and picks up a single
Clark to Dravid, no run slower ball this time, Dravid defends it immaculately down the ground
Clark to Dravid, no run good cutter this time, short of a length and moving away, Dravid plays and misses. This is almost like a Test match now.

Clark to Dravid, no run fuller this time but wide of the stumps and Dravid, almost as if he's in a shell, can't make contact. These overs could hurt India later. Australia sitting pretty as of now. Will the fifth bowler make the difference?
Hopes to Dhoni, 1 run driven to mid-off and complete a quick single, Hodge gets the direct hit but Dhoni makes his ground
Hopes to Dravid, no run drifting down leg, tries to ruen it away but can't make contact. He's definitely bogged down here
Hopes to Dravid, no run another dot. There have been a string of them in the last few overs, tapped to the off side
Hopes to Dravid, FOUR runs finally he breaks the shackles, driving forcefully past mid-off for a boundary, stand and deliver stuff from Dravid
Hopes to Dravid, no run flicked away to backward square leg but there's a fielder prowling
Hopes to Dravid, no run
Clarke to Dhoni, no run Quick one that angles in from off to leg, Dhoni plonks his front foot forward and there's a big appeal but he had taken a long stride forward
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run stopped on the batsman, Dhoni picks it up from off and turns it to midwicket for a single
Clarke to Dravid, no run stifles with a straight, quick ball on middle and leg, Dravid tries to turn it in the gap but just can't find it
Clarke to Dravid, 1 run caressed away to the extra cover region for a single, at the moment India need more than that. Clarke enjoying a good start
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run tapped to the off side for a quick one

Clarke to Dravid, 2 runs turned to the fine-leg region for a couple. Five off the over, Australia will take that for the part-timer. It's the fifth bowler option and India need to do their bit to exploit that.
Hopes to Dhoni, no run Nagging line again, Dhoni can't get the timing right, only manages a thick inside edge
Hopes to Dhoni, 1 run pushed firmly down the ground for a single
Hopes to Dravid, no run angled to the off side but straight to the fielder, dot, dot, dot
Hopes to Dravid, 2 wide down the leg side, deflects off Gilchrist's pads and they pick up one. Wide called.
Hopes to Dhoni, no run Deceptive bowler Hopes. Uses his wrists and shoulder speed well to generate some unexpected pace and bounce. Tough to get away when under pressure
Hopes to Dhoni, 1 run Worked away to leg for a single
Hopes to Dravid, 1 run full and on off, driven to long-off for a single
Clarke to Dravid, no run tries the paddle sweep but the length is a bit too short, he gets caught in a tangle there
Clarke to Dravid, 1 run pushed to midwicket for a single, Clarke beaming here, and why wouldn't he?
Clarke to Dhoni, FOUR runs short ball and that's brutalised through midwicket for four. Marginally short of length and he rocks back and jabs it away through midwicket for four
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run
Clarke to Dravid, no run full and straight, Dravid cautiously defends it back to the bowler
Clarke to Dravid, 1 run on the pads and whipped away behind square for a single
Hogg to Dravid, SIX runs Bang! Good afternoon Mr Hogg. Dravid seizes a short delivery, rocks back and whistles it over midwicket for a six. Intent, it seems
Hogg to Dravid, no run
Hogg to Dravid, 1 run tucked away behind square for a single.
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run tossed up on off, Dhoni pushes it firmly to long-off for a single
Hogg to Dravid, no run not much turn for Hogg, might rely more on the top-spinners here, defended cautiously
Hogg to Dravid, 1 run
Clarke to Dravid, 1 run uppishly scooped in the covers and luckily for Dravid no fielder there, gets in between short extra cover and point. That could have been close
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run on the back foot and forced down the ground for a single
Clarke to Dravid, 4 byes goes for the cute paddle sweep but that misses everything, down the leg side and it's four byes behind the keeper.
Clarke to Dravid, 1 run cut away comfortably for a single
Clarke to Dhoni, no run Dhoni looks to maneuvre the ball to third man but ends up pushing it to the covers instead
Clarke to Dhoni, no run defended watchfully

Hogg to Dravid, OUT That's the sort of catch that wins matches. Mitchell Johnson, almost like a ballerina, judges a skier to perfection and produces a YouTube moment. Dravid launches into a slog sweep, it goes high towards midwicket and the crowd is already cheering the six when Johnson gets under it, watches
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run
Hogg to Pathan, no run some spin now for Hogg, slightly on the short side but patted to the off side

Hogg to Pathan, no run full and spining away, Pathan drives but is comprehensively beaten, Gilchrist whips off the bails but Pathan keeps his back-foot in. Suddenly there is some good spin here. Two slips in place
Hogg to Pathan, no run ripper, big spin now, beaten all ends up, this is going to be a tall order now

Hogg to Pathan, no run googly this time, that was perilously close, pitching outside off and ripping in viciously, Pathan has no clue and is beaten. Huge appeal but umpire Suresh Shastri turns it down
Clarke to Dhoni, no run pushed back to the bowler
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run slightly short, cut away to point for a single
Clarke to Pathan, no run straight and quick, Pathan carefully pats it back
Clarke to Pathan, no run a faster one again, conteasting spinners Hogg and Clarke. One orthodox and another chinaman. Pushed back without adventure
Clarke to Pathan, 1 run

Clarke to Dhoni, OUT Now that's reckless. Another wicket goes down and this time to a run-out. Dhoni worked it to the on side and thought of a single. Pathan was too far down the track when he was sent back. Hogg flung it back to the bowler, who collected and back-flicked it onto the stumps in one motion. Path
Hogg to Harbhajan, no run worked away tentatively
Hogg to Harbhajan, no run
Hogg to Harbhajan, 1 run cut away tamely to the off side
Hogg to Dhoni, no run prodigious spin again, from off to middle, bowling a bit quicker too, Dhoni manages to get bat to ball but can't find the gap
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run cut away past cover for a single

Hogg to Harbhajan, no run turned to the leg side but Hayden, at short leg, is prowling there. This is like the final day of a Test now with spinners turning it on and close in fielders playing their part
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run defended to the off side and scamper a quick single
Clarke to Harbhajan, 1 run patted to the off side and finds the gap, single duly taken
Clarke to Dhoni, no run slightly short and turning away from Dhoni, hit hard into the ground but Symonds is waiting there, so no risks taken
Clarke to Dhoni, no run
Clarke to Dhoni, no run tries to nudge to the off side but can't pierce the gap still
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run slightly short, pulled away to midwicket for a single
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run worked away wide of mid-on for a quick single. Is the Kangaroo bolted? Looks like at the moment. Dhoni, though, appears as cool as ever
Hogg to Harbhajan, 1 run Harbhajan goes for the sweep, top-edges it high but it drops wide of deep fine leg, they take a single
Hogg to Dhoni, SIX runs Now then. That was a massive one, Dhoni charges down the ground and wallops it several miles over midwicket for a huge one, hard, high and handsome
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run drifting on the pads and defended tentatively
Hogg to Harbhajan, 1 run cheeky paddle sweep from Harbhajan, takes it from outside off and manages to beat the leg gully too, single taken
Hogg to Dhoni, no run pushed to cover
Clarke to Harbhajan, no run full on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
Clarke to Harbhajan, no run flighted on off, turns away, Harbhajan gives a bit of room and fends to point
Clarke to Powar, 1 run Powar drives a fullish delivery down the ground
Clarke to Dhoni, no run flighted outside off and left alone
Clarke to Dhoni, no run pushed to the off side
Lee to Powar, no run full, outside off, dug out to third man
Lee to Powar, no run
Lee to Powar, no run raw pace, 88 mph, fired in on middle stump, Powar stands out side leg and defends back to the bowler
Lee to Powar, (no ball) full toss outside off, Lee oversteps, the ball fizzes past Powar and the keeper and races away for four
Lee to Powar, 1 run short of a length outside off, Powar opens the face of the bat and glides past point
Lee to Dhoni, no run good line and length delivery on the stumps, Dhoni backs away a little but only manags to play it back to the bowler
Clarke to Powar, 1 run on leg, tucked away to the on side
Clarke to Dhoni, no run pushed towards cover
Clarke to Dhoni, no run good loop and turn, Dhoni sticks his bat out at it but is beaten
Clarke to Dhoni, no run defends back to the bowler
Clarke to Dhoni, 1 run full, on off and middle, Dhoni gets forward and drives down to long-on
Clarke to Powar, FOUR runs flighted, the batsman gives the charge and lofts over mid-on - only just, the fielder stretches out his left hand trying to reach that
Lee to Dhoni, 1 run bowls from wide of the crease, driven firmly down to long-off
Lee to Powar, no run fullish, driven to the off side
Lee to Powar, 1 run short, outside off, Powar waits on it and cuts fiercely past point, the deep cover fielder runs across and stops it
Lee to Dhoni, no run
Lee to Dhoni, 1 run slower ball, 63 mph, lands on a full length wide outside off, Dhoni waits on it and cuts past point on the front foot
Lee to Powar, 1 run full and outside off, driven down to long-off
Clarke to Powar, 2 runs tossed up outside off, driven firmly past the infield, deep cover runs across and stops it
Clarke to Powar, SIX runs Powar throws his might at it and it's maximum, flighted outside off, he lofts over long-off, Powar finally shows his potential as a batsman, lets see if he can repeat that
Clarke to Powar, no run
Clarke to Powar, no run
Clarke to Powar, no run pushed back to the off side
Lee to Dhoni, 1 run slower ball, 73 mph, Lee slips that wide outside off, Dhoni stretches for that and pushes it to the deep on the off side
Lee to Khan, no run fended away to the off side
Lee to Khan, 1 run quicker delivery, a firm front foot push sends that to the deep on the off side, confident way to get off the mark
Lee to Dhoni, no run Lee slips in a fast yorker, Dhoni does well to get his bat down and dig it out
Lee to Dhoni, no run short, the ball sails over Dhoni's head, he glances at the umpire hoping for a wide call
Lee to Dhoni, no run full, on off stump, pushed to mid-off
Clarke to Khan, no run tossed on off stump, defended to the on side
Clarke to Khan, no run tossed on off stump, defended to silly point
Clarke to Khan, no run pushed in faster, driven back to Clarke
Clarke to Khan, no run tossed on middle, solid forward defensive stroke by Zaheer
Clarke to Khan, no run tossed on middle and leg, defended back to Clarke
Clarke to Khan, no run short of a good length on middle, rocks on the backfoot and defends to Clarke
Hogg to Dhoni, no run googly, beats Dhoni on the off side drive
Hogg to Dhoni, 2 leg byes drifting on the hips, Dhoni tucks it away to fine leg
Hogg to Dhoni, 2 runs tossed on the pads, Dhoni flicks it fine again, Haddin at fine leg does really well to cut it off before the rope
Hogg to Dhoni, no run
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run tossed on leg, tucked to the on side
Hogg to Khan, no run flighted on off and middle, defended softly on the front foot
Johnson to Dhoni, no run that was quite wide outside off, Dhoni lets it go hopong for a wide call, Bucknor thinks about it and does nothing
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run bowling round round the wicket, wide outside off, glided to third man
Johnson to Khan, 1 run
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run
Johnson to Khan, no run back of a length on middle, opens the face of the bat and fends to point
Johnson to Khan, 1 run fuller delivery, on off stump, driven firmly on the front foot to long-off
Hogg to Khan, no run flighted on leg, pushed to mid-on
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run big turn coming into him, struck high on the pads
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run good delivery, beats him outside off
Hogg to Sreesanth, 1 run full, outside off, driven to mid-off and Sreesanth sets off fast
Hogg to Dhoni, no run beaten outsie off on the drive
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run quick delivery on the channel outside off, the ball climbs on Sreesanth who lets it go
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run short, aiming at the body, fended off to the off side rather uneasily
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run short of a length on middle, Sreesanth defends

Johnson to Sreesanth, 1 run takes a few paces forward aiming for the almightly heave over the boundary, Johnson adjusts his length and lands it shorter, Sreesanth ends up cutting it square on the off side
Johnson to Dhoni, no run good length on middle, defended back to the bowler
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 leg bye good length outside off, dended to the off side
Hogg to Dhoni, no run short and pulled hard, Clarke dives at the deep square leg boundary and just manages to cut it off
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 wide down the leg side
Hogg to Dhoni, no run outside off and pushed to the off side
Hogg to Dhoni, no run full, outside off, goes for the expansive drive and ends up playing an inside out stroke to the on side
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run short, in the slot to pull, Sreesanth rocks back and pulls but doesnt time it well, the ball lands over the midwicket circle
Hogg to Sreesanth, 1 run
Hogg to Dhoni, no run beaten, Gilchrist whips off the bails, Dhoni drags his foot back on time
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run Wild slog sweep, Sreesanth can't make contact, Johnson has a few words, Sreesanth the local boy loves it
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run Short and well directed, Sreesanth ducks under it. All over bar the shouting now
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run full and wide of the stumps, Sreesanth misses again, he's wearing glasses but nothing seems to be working, Johnson enjoying this
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run short of a length and beaten again. Too good for Sreesanth.
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run short and straight, Sreesanth backs away and swings as if there was no tomorrow, can't make contact again.
Johnson to Sreesanth, no run down the track and inside edged to short fine leg
Hogg to Dhoni, no run pushed to the off side
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run punched away forcefully to extra cover and, surprise surprise, takes a single. After not taking a single in the previous over. Strange logic this
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run tucked away to fine leg and scampers a single but Suresh Shastri, the umpire, sends him back because there was no stroke played

Hogg to Sreesanth, 1 run short and pulled away in front of square for a single. This is quite pointless now but unfortunately there is nothing in the rules to stop the game. If this was boxing, things could have been different.
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run
Johnson to Dhoni, 2 runs full and on off, Dhoni smacks it over long-on for a couple, one bounce to the fielder
Johnson to Dhoni, FOUR runs stands and delivers a powerful four to the extra cover region, Dhoni standing alone on the burning deck but it's obviously too little too late
Johnson to Dhoni, no run pushed back down the ground
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run driven confidently to cover for a single, these are just the last rites now.
Johnson to Sreesanth, 1 wide down the leg side, called wide and rightly so
Johnson to Sreesanth, 1 wide another one, this time way outside off
Johnson to Sreesanth, 1 run backs away and skies it over mid-off, Haddin runs back but he was always struggling to get there, they settle for one
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run punched to mid-off for a single, that's Dhoni's fifty, a phyrric effort but he hung in there. It's 50 off 80 balls. India need 97 off 30 balls with just one wicket remaining
Hogg to Dhoni, 1 run slogged to midwicket for a single
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run a swing and a miss, some turn for Hogg, Sreesanth doesn't get bat on ball
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run turning in from off to middle, Sreesanth tries to glide it down to third man but can't get it past square
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run attempted slog sweep but can't get the timing right
Hogg to Sreesanth, no run down the track but misses again. Any problems with those glasses, Sree? Actually Hogg is tough to hit, even for quality batsmen
Hogg to Sreesanth, 2 leg byes spins back into him and they collect two leg byes
Hopes to Dhoni, no run straight and full, smacked to square leg but they decline the single
Hopes to Dhoni, no run defended back to the bowler, still keeping it tight

Hopes to Dhoni, no run That's a KO. Full and straight, Dhoni cracks it powerfully and knocks Sreesanth out cold. He can't get out of the way, in the non-striker's end, and seems to have suffered a serious blow to the head. The Australian fielders are surrounding him and he's getting some treatment now. That wo
Hopes to Dhoni, no run smacked down to long-off but he doesn't take a single
Hopes to Dhoni, 1 run tapped to cover for a single
Hopes to Sreesanth, 1 run slower ball this time and Sreesanth defends it to mid-off and takes off for a single
Hogg to Sreesanth, 1 run outside leg stump, flicked away for a single
Hogg to Dhoni, SIX runs flighted up outside off, Dhoni brings out the whiplash and smotes it over midwicket for six
Thank you for joining us for this one. From me, Siddhartha Vaidyanathan, and my fellow commentator Kanishkaa Balachandran it's good night and good luck.
There will be talk about India's decision at the toss but Australia were no doubt the better team overall. The series now moves to Hyderabad where the team clash in the third one-dayer on October 5.

Chasing 307 was never going to be easy and India's top-order wobble meant they were always playing catch up. The Australians bowled with discipline and fielded with energy and the spinners finally sealed the issue on a wearing pitch.

So that ends what's been a largely one-sided clash with Australia taking a 1-0 lead. They posted a 300-plus score for the second successive game and recovered from a shaky start as they had done in Bangalore.
Australia won by 84 runs
Player of the match is Brad Haddin, AUS
